content:
Hi!
Discord has this feature which lets you sort the users list by role. I was wondering if something similar can be done in Zulip: can the online users be sorted by user groups they have been assigned?
I'm new around here, so it this has already been considered, I apologise for the spam (and could somebody direct me to an appropriate thread?). Thanks!

@Neeraj Deshmukh I don't think we have an issue for that. One thing that's a little tricky is that user groups aren't disjoint sets; so we could sort by role (owner/administrator/etc.), but not easily by user groups.

@Tim Abbott On Discord the way this works is you can list the "Roles" in a order of importance. Then the user get sorted into the "Roles" topmost role assigned to them. I don't know how tricky this will be to do since I don't have much coding experience.

We're currently have a workaround for this by appending - GroupName tags on the Display Name until the Users panel can be grouped. We use LDAP and have Full Name modification turned off for Members. I think it would be beneficial to leverage the User Groups setting for this.
I would love to see the Users search field return @groups as well.
@Andy Molenda interesting re: user groups; what would you expect to be displayed if someone typed a user group in the right sidebar?

@Tim Abbott Return the users who are members of the group, '@usergroup' itself listed top most.

Selecting the @usergroup could also possibly lead to a PM to @usergroup similar to @all/@everyone. Members of the user group could receive notifications via @usergroup since it functions effectively like @all. There would need to be a Notification configuration option if this functions like I assume (haven't looked at the actual code yet).

This would allow for membership visibility outside of Stream subscription and doesn't require Admin or Owner role permissions in Zulip to view it.
Also, typing @ in user search would return @usergroups
